definition: crash (course)/accelerated (process)/quick (fix)/instant (success)/to achieve in a short time
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Homer Software continues its rapid growth and is acquired for $100m.
sentences.chinese: 荷馬軟件保持高速成長，並以1億美元的價格被收購。

sentences.english: I want to attend a speed-up course class to improve my computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 我想參加一個速成班來提高我的電腦水平。

sentences.english: There's an audience for non-nuanced, microwaveable solutions.
sentences.chinese: 無差別的速成解決方案還是有聽衆的。

sentences.english: A: Do you think it will help?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得速成班會有幫助嗎？

sentences.english: A group of girls gave Wolfowitz a crash course in reassembling televisions.
sentences.chinese: 一些女孩給了沃爾福威茨一個組裝電視機的速成課。

sentences.english: IFC also investment and supporting China's fast growth of small and medium-sized enterprises.
sentences.chinese: IFC還投資並扶持中國高速成長的中小企業。

sentences.english: In the community care and support of the company to the rapid growth.
sentences.chinese: 在社會各界的關心和支持下公司得以高速成長。

sentences.english: A crash course in color theory will go a long way.
sentences.chinese: 在色彩理論上個速成班對你大有裨益。

sentences.english: I took a crash course in skiing before going on vacation.
sentences.chinese: 度假前我參加了一個滑雪速成班。

sentences.english: He finished in two years and by the time he was 22 had completed medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他在兩年後唸完了速成班，22歲從醫學院畢業。

sentences.english: Some will grow faster; others will lose market share.
sentences.chinese: 部分公司將高速成長，其他的則會丟掉市場份額。

sentences.english: They should take some crash courses to catch up with their classmates.
sentences.chinese: 他們應該參加一些速成課程來趕上他們的同學。

sentences.english: I did a 15-week crash course in typing.
sentences.chinese: 我上了一個15周的打字速成班。

sentences.english: She was given some quick training at the vocational school.
sentences.chinese: 她在職業學校受過速成訓練。

sentences.english: At present, the milk industry has already entered a new stage after five years' high-speed development.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我國奶業經過五年高速成長已進入新階段。

sentences.english: He will get a crash course in French.
sentences.chinese: 他要去參加一個法語速成班。

definition: secret book or collection of books
canonical text/treasury (i.e. book of treasured wisdom)
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
a trick/an ingenious method/know-how/the knack (of doing sth)
